title: A Test for Equal Proportions
question_text:
Best friends Mary and Samantha recently found out they were born on the same day of the week (both were born on a Friday)! They wonder if births are evenly distributed across the days of the week. To explore this, they take a random sample of citizens from their large city. Here is the distribution of $200$ births:
DaySundayMondayTuesdayWednesdayThursdayFridaySaturday
Births$25$$32$$39$$21$$28$$29$$26$
Which of the following sets of hypotheses is correct to use to analyze this data?

choices.text: Ho: Birth days in this local area are not evenly distributed across the days of the week Ha: Birth days in this local area are evenly distributed across the days of the week
Ho: Birth days in this local area are evenly distributed across the days of the week Ha: Birth days in this local area are not evenly distributed across the days of the week

Ho: The proportion of births that occur on a Friday is
14.5
% Ha: The proportion of births that occur on a Friday is higher than
14.5
%

Ho: The proportion of births that occur on a Friday is higher than
14.5
% Ha: The proportion of births that occur on a Friday is
14.5
%
Ho: Birth days and days of the week are not related. Ha: Birth days and days of the week are related.
